citations.narrative:
The written program of veterinary care is incomplete. There is no written frequency provided for vaccinating dogs for
distemper or parvovirus. There is no written plan for prevention, sampling, or treatment of ectoparasites, blood parasites,
or intestinal parasites. The program of veterinary care is a required document that APHIS inspectors use to determine the
quality of veterinary care provided to the animals at a facility. This document must address all the information required in
section 3.13(a) and be followed by the licensee to ensure adequate care and treatment of the animals. All required
information listed in section 3.13(a) must be included in the program of veterinary care.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by Feb. 24 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The written program of veterinary care is incomplete. There is no written frequency provided  for vaccinating dogs for 
distemper or parvovirus.  There is no written plan for prevention,  sampling, or treatment of ectoparasites, blood parasites, 
or intestinal parasites. The program of veterinary  care is a required document that APHIS inspectors use to determine the 
quality of veterinary care provided  to the animals at a facility. This document must address all the information required in 
section 3.13(a) and be followed by the licensee to ensure adequate care and treatment of the animals. All required 
information listed in section 3.13(a) must be included in the program of veterinary care. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by Feb. 24 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
